body_html:
@liangwang the reason is simply that, the design of SparseTensor already hardcodes the associated shape as tf.int64 [1], so any downstream ops that consume these objects assume likewise as well.

[1] https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/sparse_tensor.py#L59
body_text:
@liangwang the reason is simply that, the design of SparseTensor already hardcodes the associated shape as tf.int64 [1], so any downstream ops that consume these objects assume likewise as well.
[1] https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/sparse_tensor.py#L59
body:
@liangwang the reason is simply that, the design of `SparseTensor` already hardcodes the associated shape as `tf.int64` [1], so any downstream ops that consume these objects assume likewise as well.

[1] https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/sparse_tensor.py#L59
